children.text: The bottom plates have only been fixed to the floors with nails spaced up to 1000mm centres, and some sections not nailed at all.
It is a requirement of Australian Standard AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, clause 9.5 Nominal Fixing (Minimum Fixing), that
‘Bottom plates between 38 to 50mm thick be fixed to joists with 2/90 x 3.05mm nails at maximum 600mm centres’ .
The fixing of all the bottom plates must be rectified in compliance with the above.
